intro: Iodanthus dentatus, commonly known as the common iodanthus, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Iodanthus dentatus is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it blooms from June to August.
